awd_titl_txt: The Belmont International Sustainability Fellows Program: Sustainability in the Human Age, Across Disciplines, Cultures, and Borders
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports a cohort-based, undergraduate program that seeks to help develop the next generation of sustainability science leaders.  This collaborative fellowship program connects undergraduates with today's sustainability science leaders and seeks to provide the students with cooperative research opportunities.  This program seeks to help the students develop essential skills in generating and applying knowledge and developing actions that speed the transition toward a more globally sustainable future.  The students will work directly with established research teams, and engage in activities that will build substantive connections with each group of fellows.  The structure will help to build the next-generation international sustainability science leaders, equipped to collaborate and innovate across cultures, disciplines, and nationalities. The program will produce multimedia educational materials focused on building role models and expanding the diversity of narratives represented in global change research and sustainability science. The program will broaden the STEM diversity in some of urban development's most pressing issues and build greater capacity.

por.por_cntn:
The Global Sustainability Scholars (GSS) program has achieved significant impacts in its pursuit of fostering a new generation of transdisciplinary sustainability scientists and innovators from underrepresented groups in STEM fields. Sustainability Science, focused on addressing the needs of future generations while tackling poverty and conserving the planet's ecosystems, has rapidly grown as a field where STEM disciplines are applied. GSS recognizes the centrality of inclusion, equity, and diversity in this mission. After all, sustainable development and transdisciplinary research depend on legitimacy, credibility, and engagement with diverse stakeholders. This program recognizes and support the potential of underrepresented young scholars and early career graduate students within STEM fields worldwide as a pivotal factor in scaling STEM-inspired innovations for sustainability.

Over five years, GSS has established itself as a catalyst for change, bridging disciplinary boundaries and nurturing emerging leaders who hold a strong commitment to sustainable solutions. A key achievement has been in recruiting, training, and supporting diverse cohorts of Scholars and Fellows, both undergraduates and early career graduate students, to engage in impactful research projects. By promoting systems thinking, transdisciplinary approaches, and team science, GSS addresses the typical isolation of high-performing STEM students within specific disciplines, enhancing their capacity to connect learning to real-world impact.  In total we have supported 37 youg scholars broadening thier experiences and professional networks. The program has managed to achieve high retention and graduation rates, even during the disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, which have surpassed national averages.

GSS has built an international professional network for participants, embedding them in 17 international sustainability projects across diverse contexts. Students have traveled and worked with international leaders in the field, including projects based in Germany, United Kingdom, France, Norway, Madagascar, and Switzerland). These experiences have enabled participants to engage with professionals, attend international meetings, and learn about engaged scholardhip approaches to sustainability issues. The program has effectively created a community of practice, fostering sharing of transdisciplinary research best practices at local, national, and international levels. GSS has collaborated with various academic networks addressing interdisciplinary research, leadership training, and more. This network-building approach has contributed to a rich and diverse exchange of ideas, insights, and experiences.

The training and professional development provided by GSS have been transformative. It offers students the chance to develop self-awareness, critical professional skills, and sustainability technical expertise. The program supports participants in navigating complex professional landscapes, addressing topics such as imposter syndrome, networking strategies, and interdisciplinary collaboration. By fostering mentorship and teaching opportunities, GSS helps participants develop a deep sense of belonging and a robust skill set, positioning them for impactful contributions in their careers.

Through its dedicated efforts, GSS has achieved its intended goals: empowering underrepresented individuals to be key contributors in sustainability science and policy. The program's diverse cohort and holistic training approach have engendered a strong sense of community, enabling participants to gain valuable insights into global sustainability challenges and foster international collaboration. The impact of GSS is evident in the academic and professional achievements of its participants, who have advanced to graduate programs, obtained honors, and actively contributed to research and projects that address pressing sustainability issues.

Overall, the program's accomplishments highlight its effectiveness in building a diverse and impactful community of emerging sustainability scientists and innovators, bridging gaps between disciplines, cultures, and continents to drive positive change on a global scale.
